0.title: My daughter passed TET, she has certificate: Mondal amid job row
0.article_body: Arrested TMC leader Anubrata Mondal on Thursday denied that his daughter was appointed to a primary school without clearing the Teacher Eligibility Test (TET). "She has passed the test and has a certificate to prove it," Mondal said. Calcutta High Court summoned Sukanya Mondal after a petitioner alleged that she got the post of a teacher without clearing the TET.

1.title: Basketball player pushed from stadium roof by 3 for resisting rape in Moga
1.article_body: An 18-year-old basketball player was reportedly pushed from the stadium roof by three youths for resisting rape in Punjab's Moga. The incident took place on August 12, when she had gone to the stadium for practice, her father said in the complaint. She suffered multiple fractures and injuries in her legs and jaw and is currently hospitalised.

2.title: Lyricist Ko Sesha shares pic of meat in veg meal, asks Swiggy's K'taka head to apologise
2.article_body: Lyricist Ko Sesha took to Twitter to call out Swiggy for their customer service after he found meat pieces in a vegetarian dish he had ordered from The Bowl Company in Bengaluru. "What's worse was Swiggy customer care offered me...compensation of ₹70 for 'offending my religious sentiments'," he wrote. He further demanded Swiggy's Karnataka head to apologise to him.

3.title: CoWIN app with UIP's pilot likely to be launched in Sept: Report
3.article_body: Universal Immunisation Programme (UIP) is likely to be launched on the revamped version of CoWIN application in mid-September, a report said. The pilot project, which will be implemented in two districts of each state and Union Territories, will help to digitise session planning and update vaccination status. UIP is likely to be rolled out nationally after three months.

4.title: Indian apps saw 200% increase in active monthly users in 2021: Google
4.article_body: Google data shows that there has been a 200% increase in active monthly users in 2021 as compared to 2019, especially for applications and games published by Indian developers. Indian apps and games have witnessed a 150% increase outside India for the time spent metric. Google Play now has 2.5 billion active users globally.

5.title: 16 killed, 18 missing in flash floods in western China
5.article_body: At least 16 people have been killed and 18 are missing after a rainstorm caused a landslide and flash flooding in western China, state media CCTV said on Thursday. The rains on Wednesday night affected over 6,000 people in Qinghai province, CCTV said. Emergency authorities described the flooding as a "mountain torrent".

6.title: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy to host UN chief, Turkish Prez in Lviv
6.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy will be hosting Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan and UN Secretary-General António Guterres in Lviv on Thursday. Apart from the diplomatic efforts to end the Russia-Ukraine war, the situation in Russian-controlled Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant in south Ukraine will be discussed. The leaders will also explore ways to expand grain exports from Ukraine.

7.title: Warwickshire sign Mohammed Siraj for the County Championship
7.article_body: Warwickshire has signed India pacer Mohammed Siraj for the last three matches of the County Championship season. "I can't wait to join up with the Bears squad. I've always enjoyed playing in England...and I'm excited to experience county cricket," said Siraj after getting signed. Siraj will arrive at Edgbaston ahead of Warwickshire's match against Somerset, beginning on September 12.

8.title: Indian startup ecosystem saw 173 acquisitions in 1st half of 2022: Report
8.article_body: The Indian startup ecosystem in the first half of 2022 saw a total of 173 acquisitions, as per data from global startup data platform Tracxn. While the first half of 2021 saw 98 acquisitions, in the whole calendar year there were 244 startup acquisitions. In H1 2022, startup investments saw 54% year-on-year growth at $13.3 billion across 506 deals.

9.title: Japan launches contest inviting ideas to increase alcohol consumption & boost economy
9.article_body: The Japanese government has launched a nationwide competition calling for ideas to encourage people to drink more alcohol as reduced alcohol consumption has led to a decrease in tax revenue. 'The Sake Viva!' campaign is being run by the National Tax Agency (NTA). The group running it said that new habits during COVID-19 led to a decline in alcohol sales.

10.title: Kapil Sharma's 'Zwigato' to have its world premiere at TIFF 2022
10.article_body: Comedian-actor Kapil Sharma today shared the first look of his upcoming film 'Zwigato' and announced that it will have its world premiere at the 47th Toronto International Film Festival (TIFF) in September. The film, which stars Kapil as a food delivery partner, will be screened in the Contemporary World Cinema section. 'Zwigato', set in Bhubaneswar, is directed by Nandita Das.

11.title: For some weird reason, I never had the best feelings in Cincinnati Open: Nadal
11.article_body: World number three Rafael Nadal, who crashed out of the ongoing Cincinnati Open after suffering defeat in his first game in the tournament, said he never had the "best feelings" for the tournament. He added, "This tournament hasn't been the easiest for me during all my tennis career." Nadal has won the Cincinnati Open once in his career so far.

12.title: Airtel pays ₹8,312.4 cr for 5G spectrum, settles 4 years' dues upfront
12.article_body: Telecom operator Bharti Airtel on Wednesday said that it has paid ₹8,312.4 crore towards dues for spectrum acquired in the 5G auction to the Department of Telecommunications. With this, the company has paid four years of spectrum dues upfront. Airtel has cleared ₹24,333.7 crore of its deferred spectrum liabilities over the past year much ahead of scheduled maturities, it said.

13.title: Singapore to have more millionaires per population than US by 2030: HSBC
13.article_body: The number of millionaires in Singapore with respect to its population will be more than that of US, China or any other Asia-Pacific economy in the next eight years, according to an HSBC report. Singapore's 7.5% adult population had at least $1 million in wealth in 2021. This number could rise to 9.8% in 2025 and to 13.4% in 2030.

14.title: Domestic air passenger traffic sees 7.6% decline in July: DGCA
14.article_body: With 97 lakh domestic passengers travelling by air in July, airlines registered a 7.6% decline in passenger traffic compared to 1.05 crore in June, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) said in a report. A total of 6.69 crore people travelled on domestic flights between January and July, DGCA said. In July, IndiGo had 58.8% share of domestic market.

15.title: Vietnam asks tech companies to store users' data locally
15.article_body: Vietnam's government ordered technology firms and social media companies including Google and Facebook to store users' data locally and set up local offices. "Data...ranging from financial records and biometric data to information on...ethnicity and political views...must be stored domestically," the decree said. Authorities will have the right to issue data collection requests for investigation.

16.title: Assam to send 1,000 youth to visit Cellular Jail to instil nationalism
16.article_body: The Assam government is planning to send 1,000 youth to visit Cellular Jail in Andaman and Nicobar Islands where several freedom fighters were imprisoned during the British rule. The trip, a part of 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav', will help in instilling nationalism in the youth by drawing inspiration from freedom fighters, Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said on Thursday.

17.title: Andhra MSMEs given ₹1,463 crore incentives: CM Jagan Mohan Reddy
17.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy said that the state government has given incentives worth ₹1,463 crore to micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) that employ 10 lakh people in the state. He further added that his government would invest ₹1.54 lakh crore in 56 large and mega projects to give jobs to 1.64 lakh people.

18.title: Are you not ashamed: Rahul to PM over BJP's support to Bilkis Bano convicts
18.article_body: The BJP's support to criminals displays the party's mindset towards women, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi alleged on Thursday and asked PM Narendra Modi if he was ashamed of "such politics". "Unnao...worked to save BJP MLA. Kathua...rally in favour of rapists. Hathras...the government in favour of rapists. Gujarat...the release and honour of rapists," Rahul said.

19.title: Man kills wife in B'luru after she denies him sex saying he's uncivilised
19.article_body: A man in Bengaluru strangulated his wife to death after she allegedly denied him sex, saying he was uncivilised. The accused later dumped her body in Shiradi Ghat, went to police and filed a missing complaint. During interrogation, he confessed to his crime and told police he was upset with her as she accused him of behaving like an animal.

20.title: Our morale will be higher as we beat India at the same venue: Sarfaraz
20.article_body: Discussing the upcoming Asia Cup match between Pakistan and India in Dubai, ex-Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed said Pakistan's morale will be higher having defeated the latter by 10 wickets at the same venue in T20 World Cup 2021. "Pakistan know the conditions very well because we've played PSL here and many home series," he added. "India...don't have...much experience," stated Sarfaraz.

21.title: 72% of Bihar ministers face criminal cases: Report
21.article_body: About 72% of the newly sworn-in ministers in Bihar have declared criminal cases against themselves, according to a report of Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR). The poll rights body, which analysed the affidavits of 32 ministers, found that 17 ministers face serious criminal cases against them. CM Nitish Kumar and Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav also have cases registered against them.

22.title: Developments in Bihar 'positive sign' for country's politics: Akhilesh
22.article_body: Commenting on the political developments in Bihar, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Thursday said it is a "positive sign" for the country’s politics. When asked about the developments in the state, Yadav said, "Political allies are not happy with BJP. See in UP what they (BJP allies) are getting. One day they will also run away from them," Yadav added.

23.title: Deepak Chahar registers figures of 3/27 on India comeback, Twitter users react
23.article_body: Playing his first international game since February, India pacer Deepak Chahar picked three wickets while conceding 27 runs in his seven overs in the first ODI against Zimbabwe. Reacting to his performance, a Twitter user wrote, "Deepak should be a sure shot selection in the T20 World Cup squad." IPL franchise DC wrote, "It's like he has never been away."

24.title: UP woman cuts live-in partner's genitals after he tries to rape her daughter
24.article_body: A 36-year-old woman from UP chopped off the genitals of her 32-year-old live-in partner after he allegedly tried to rape her 14-year-old daughter. The woman said that she was working in a farm when the incident took place. The woman claimed that she reached home just in time and caught her partner red-handed, following which she took the step.

25.title: Reliance Jio adds 42.2 lakh users in June, VI loses 18 lakh: TRAI
25.article_body: Reliance Jio has added 42.2 lakh new mobile customers in June, Bharti Airtel added 7.9 lakh customers while Vodafone Idea lost 18 lakh users, according to the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI). Reliance Jio registered second consecutive growth month after May with 31 lakh customers. Jio's total wireless subscriber count stood at 41.3 crore as of June 30, 2022.

26.title: Boat found with AK-47 rifles belongs to an Australian woman: Maharashtra Deputy CM
26.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis has said the boat which was found carrying AK-47 rifles and other weapons off Raigad coast belongs to an Australian woman. "Her husband is the captain and they were going from Muscat to Europe. The boat's engine was damaged...A Korean boat rescued them," he said. "There's no confirmation of any terror angle," he added.

27.title: We don't have a busy int'l schedule: Rashid on playing in T20 leagues
27.article_body: Afghanistan spinner Rashid Khan has said he's able to participate in T20 leagues around the world due to their not-so-hectic international schedule. "We don't have that kind of busy schedule for international matches...If that was the case for me, then definitely I would've picked [only] a few leagues," he stated. Afghanistan last played a Test in March 2021.

28.title: Goa becomes 1st state to provide 100% tap water connections to rural homes
28.article_body: Goa has become the first state in India to provide 100% tap water connections in all rural homes under the 'Har Ghar Jal' scheme. All the 2.63 lakh households in the state have been provided with potable tap water connections at a cost of over ₹200 crore in the past three years. The state also has 100% metered water connections.

29.title: People have apprehensions: NC leader on voting rights to outsiders in J&K
29.article_body:
Criticising the move where outsiders living in J&K will also be allowed to vote in UT now, 
National Conference (NC) leader Tanvir Sadiq said the people of J&K will be disenfranchised this way. "People have several apprehensions," he added. Furthermore, he said, "With this, people from other states can just come, register, vote and then go back to their states."

30.title: 6 minor boys drown in different incidents in Madhya Pradesh's Damoh
30.article_body: Six minor boys drowned in different incidents in Madhya Pradesh's Damoh district, an official said on Thursday. In one incident, three boys from Narguvan village entered a pond where they got trapped in deep waters and drowned, police said. Similarly, two boys, aged 12 and 13 years, drowned in a water-filled pit in Kishan Taliaya area, police added.

31.title: Water quality improves in Bengaluru's Singena Agrahara lake
31.article_body: The Singena Agrahara lake in Bengaluru Urban is now free of pollution, a year after it was cleared of encroachments and sewage discharge was stopped, an internal state government report said. Water samples from the lake were tested at the Environmental Health and Safety Research & Development Centre, according to the report. Water samples were tested on 35 parameters.

32.title: Raju Srivastava's brain has stopped working: Sunil Pal
32.article_body: Comedian Sunil Pal, in a video, updated his followers about the health of fellow comedian Raju Srivastava, who's currently admitted to AIIMS following a heart attack. "Friends, please pray for Raju Srivastava...He is very critical. Even doctors are not able to understand what they should do. His brain has also stopped working," he stated.

33.title: Some production houses are still reluctant to work with me: Sunny Leone
33.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone has said that a lot of people were reluctant to work with her when she had joined the industry. "But there were lots of people who wanted to work with me...In that way, some of the more famous production houses...people are still probably reluctant to work with me," she added. However, she said it doesn't bother her.

34.title: Anurag said 'Work with Rohit if you want to be a star': Taapsee on their fight
34.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu said she had a "fight" with director Anurag Kashyap after the editing of their film 'Dobaaraa'. "He said, 'Why do you work with me? If you want to be a star, go and work with Rohit Shetty!'" added Taapsee. Kashyap earlier stated that Taapsee questions him which irritates him a lot. "Taapsee keeps needling," he had added.

35.title: 45-yr-old executive held for molesting masseuse at hotel in Mumbai
35.article_body: A 45-year-old executive with an international company was arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a 25-year-old masseuse in his room at Mumbai's Grand Hyatt Hotel on Monday. "The complainant stated that the accused touched her inappropriately when she was giving him a massage," police said. She claimed the accused also threatened her not to tell anyone about the incident, police added.

36.title: HC asks petitioners to seek SC direction on postponing BBMP polls
36.article_body: The Karnataka High Court has asked petitioners challenging the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike's (BBMP) ward delimitation exercise to get direction from the Supreme Court on whether the BBMP's elections should be postponed. Seven separate public interest litigations have challenged the delimitation exercise. The petitioners contended the delimitation exercise should be done again.

37.title: Police bust fake police station in Bihar's Banka; 5 arrested
37.article_body: Bihar police have arrested five people, including two women, for running a parallel police station in Banka district. The matter came to light on Wednesday when the SHO of Town police station, Shambhu Yadav, saw a man and woman in uniform with country-made pistol instead of an official revolver. The accused reportedly cheated people by promising jobs in police department.

38.title: Blinkit manager, delivery agent steal over ₹6 lakh from Noida store
38.article_body: The store manager at Blinkit India and a delivery agent were arrested for allegedly stealing over ₹6 lakh and several devices, the police said. The accused stole CCTV equipment installed at the store, including 2 DVRs, a Wi-Fi dongle and a laptop, so that they are not caught, said Ashutosh Dwivedi, ADCP, Noida.

39.title: Raju Srivastava's brain has stopped working: Sunil Pal
39.article_body: Comedian Sunil Pal took to Instagram to share a video wherein he updated his followers about the health of fellow comedian Raju Srivastava, who's currently admitted to AIIMS following a heart attack. "Friends, please pray for Raju Srivastava...He is very critical. Even doctors are not able to understand what they should do. His brain has also stopped working," he stated.

40.title: World’s largest sovereign wealth fund in Norway posts biggest half-year loss
40.article_body: The world’s largest sovereign wealth fund in Norway witnessed its biggest loss of $174 billion in the first half of 2022 amid inflation and fears of a global recession. The fund lost 14.4% in the six months through June. Founded in 1996, the sovereign wealth fund has a portfolio of about 9,000 stocks globally, owning 1.3% of all listed stocks.

41.title: Farooq Abdullah calls all-party meet over voting rights to outsiders in J&K
41.article_body: National Conference chief Farooq Abdullah has convened an all-party meeting on August 22 over the issue of the inclusion of outsiders in J&K electoral rolls. "He personally spoke to leaders...requested them to attend meet at 11 am on Monday," JKNC tweeted. J&K will get around 25 lakh new voters, including outsiders, after revision of electoral rolls, an official had said.

42.title: 60-yr-old Navi Mumbai man cheated of ₹7.6 lakh in fake electricity bill fraud
42.article_body:
A 60-year-old man working with an oil company in Navi Mumbai lodged a police complaint on Wednesday after he was allegedly cheated of ₹7.65 lakh in a fake electricity bill message fraud.
The complainant stated the cyber-fraudster impersonated an executive from the power supply company, tricked him into revealing his bank details and used them to siphon off the money.

43.title: FIR filed in Pune over fake RSS account's posts on Shivaji, Pawar
43.article_body: Mahesh Karpe, an RSS functionary, has filed an FIR in Pune against faux social media account 'RSS Sanghrajya', which allegedly posted objectionable comments about Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, NCP chief Sharad Pawar and others. "[The] account is not ours...This is a conspiracy against us," Karpe said. Police have booked the account's creators under several sections of the IPC.

44.title: UP man wears burqa while going to meet his girlfriend; arrested
44.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested in Uttar Pradesh's Mehmadpur for wearing a burqa while going to meet his girlfriend. Saif Ali, who got a job away from home, wanted to meet his girlfriend before moving out. So, he wore a burqa to hide his identity as he was known in the area. Ali has been booked for breach of peace.

45.title: Tulsi actives in hair oil reduce hair loss in 2 months: Kapiva
45.article_body: Kapiva shared that its Tulsi Anti Hairfall Oil contains Tulsi actives, 6 essential oils, and 19 Ayurvedic herbs heated over 24 hours to boost re-growth by 23%. Khus, methi, and hibiscus in the bottle allow continuous herbal infusion while the oil helps circulate blood to the scalp and contains natural DHT blockers that reduce hair loss, it added.

46.title: Sanju Samson picks Lionel Messi over Cristiano Ronaldo
46.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Sanju Samson picked Lionel Messi over Cristiano Ronaldo, when asked to choose one during an interaction. Samson added that former Team India captain MS Dhoni is one of his "favourite" sporting personalities. Talking about his personal life, Samson shared that he enjoys eating chocolates, adding that "Bappu" is one of his nicknames, which many people don't know.

47.title: Last nail in coffin of democracy: Mufti on voting rights to outsiders in J&K
47.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti criticised the move where outsiders living in J&K will also be allowed to vote in UT now. "J&K has become laboratory for BJP. They conduct experiments here...implement...in other places…This is last nail in the coffin of electoral democracy," Mufti said. "BJP has only one objective, to form government everywhere by resorting to any method," she added.

48.title: AAP doing low level politics: Gambhir on Rohingyas accommodation in Delhi
48.article_body: BJP MP Gautam Gambhir reacted to AAP's claim that Centre was "secretly" trying to give residence to Rohingyas in Delhi and said, "Nobody can do politics as low as [AAP]." Why was the letter demanding better accommodation for Rohingyas written? Gambhir questioned AAP. "Our stand is very clear, HM had clarified...that we want to deport the Rohingyas," Gambhir added.

49.title: B'luru Police crack 89 cases, arrest 61 suspects; goods worth ₹2 cr seized
49.article_body: Bengaluru Police's North Division on Wednesday said that they have arrested 61 suspects in connection with peddling of drugs, extortion, house break-ins and chain snatching. In total, the police cracked about 89 cases and recovered materials worth ₹2 crore, Vinayak Patil, DCP (North), tweeted. Seized goods included 722 kg of red sandalwood and 51 two-wheelers among other items, Patil added.

50.title: Comparisons with Ranveer, Ranbir don't come to me organically: Vicky
50.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal said on 'Koffee With Karan 7' that he never gets into a comparison where he does not feel equal to them. "I used to watch their (Ranbir Kapoor and Ranveer Singh) films when I wasn't even in the industry...It (comparison) just doesn't come to me organically," he added. Vicky revealed he sometimes has fan moments with them.

51.title: Sanya Malhotra and Dhairya Karwa to star in a Dharma film: Reports
51.article_body: Sanya Malhotra and Dhaiya Karwa will share the screen space in an upcoming film, which will be produced by Karan Johar's Dharma Productions. As per reports, the makers wanted a new age on-screen pairing, which is why they have finalised Sanya and Dhairya as leads. Sanya and Dhairya have previously collaborated with Dharma Productions for 'Meenakshi Sundareshwar' and 'Gehraiyaan', respectively.

52.title: I played 'terribly': Rafael Nadal on loss against Borna Coric
52.article_body: Reacting to his 6-7(9-11), 6-4, 3-6 defeat against Croatia's Borna Coric in the second round of the Cincinnati Open, Rafael Nadal said, "I played terribly...It's obvious...I was not ready enough to win the match." "The last month and a half haven't been easy, because...of the abdominal tear," added Nadal. Nadal was playing his first match in over a month.

53.title: Flipkart to invest $500,000 in 6 early-stage startups
53.article_body: E-commerce platform Flipkart, has decided to invest up to $500,000 in six early-stage startups. The investment will be done by Flipkart's venture fund, Flipkart Ventures, which was set up in 2019. The startups were selected for an accelerator programme called Flipkart Leap Ahead, a 16-week mentorship training, during which startups will present ideas to potential investors and industry leaders.

54.title: Decided won't have baby until we are able enough: Bipasha on pregnancy
54.article_body: Actress Bipasha Basu said as a couple, she and her husband Karan Singh Grover were mature to know when they wanted to become parents. She said it was their mutual decision to not embrace parenthood until they felt "able enough". Bipasha said her mother was the first to know about her pregnancy. "It was my mother's dream," she added.

55.title: 13-yr-old 'kidnapped' boy found at Pune railway station; probe on
55.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Police have launched a probe into the alleged kidnapping of a 13-year-old boy who went missing from outside his school on Tuesday and was found at Pune railway station hours later. According to an FIR filed by his father, an unidentified person allegedly kidnapped the boy and covered his face with a handkerchief before taking him on a train.

56.title: 0 penalty charges on missed Mutual Fund SIPs: Jupiter
56.article_body: Banks charge you a penalty of up to ₹750 for missing your SIP autopay mandate due to low balance, shared Jupiter, a 100% digital banking app. On Jupiter, your Mutual Fund SIP is auto-skipped if balance is low to avoid penalty charges, while you earn up to 1.5% extra returns with 0-commission Direct Mutual Funds, over regular ones, it added.

57.title: Watch Shah Rukh Khan in 'Chak De! India' to know Pandit's style: Jaffer to KKR players
57.article_body: Reacting to Chandrakant Pandit being appointed KKR head coach, ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer tweeted that he is happy for Pandit. He added, "To the KKR players unfamiliar with his coaching style, I'd suggest watching @iamsrk in 'Chak De! India' will help." Pandit is the first Indian to become KKR's head coach.

58.title: Delhi CM was kept in dark: Sisodia writes to Amit Shah on Rohingya row
58.article_body: Calling it a "conspiracy", Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia wrote a letter to Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday, criticising the Centre's move to "permanently settle" Rohingya refugees in Delhi. "Delhi Home Minister and the Chief Minister were kept in the dark," he alleged. "I came to know about this from newspapers," he wrote in the letter.

59.title: He approached me on Instagram, I answered after a long time: Morata's wife
59.article_body: Ex-Real Madrid footballer Alvaro Morata's wife Alice Campello said Alvaro asked many people to introduce him to her having seen her picture, but they had no common friends. "So, he wrote to me (on Instagram). I answered...after a long time," added Campello. "His friends and family...had never seen him like this...He kept telling...he wanted to marry me," she stated.

60.title: Players somehow come back to form against Pakistan: Danish Kaneria
60.article_body: Ex-Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria has said the upcoming match between India and Pakistan at the Asia Cup might help Virat Kohli to come out of his poor form. "Players somehow come back to form while playing against [us]," he stated. "It's a big game for Virat...because this will decide what his future will be like," added Kaneria.

61.title: Nanny sexually assaults 5-yr-old girl in Gurugram school, booked
61.article_body: A five-year-old girl was allegedly sexually assaulted by a nanny at a private school in Gurugram, said police, adding that an FIR was registered against the woman and a probe has been initiated. She told us that the staff member touched her inappropriately and threatened to lock her in a room if she informed anyone, the victim's father said.

62.title: Woman poses as house help to rob 100 houses; arrested in Ghaziabad
62.article_body: Police arrested a woman named Poonam Shah in Ghaziabad for posing as a house help and robbing almost 100 houses in cities like Delhi, Jodhpur, Kolkata and Ghaziabad. Poonam, who faces 26 cases in Delhi NCR itself, used to steal gold ornaments from her employers. She has also built a house in Delhi using the proceeds of crime, police alleged.

63.title: Boat carrying AK-47 rifles, weapons found off Maha coast; high alert sounded in state
63.article_body: A high alert has been sounded in Maharashtra after an unmanned boat carrying weapons was found off a coast in Raigad. AK-47 rifles were among the weapons recovered by the police. Police stated that the vessel, a security boat, belonged to Oman security. Dismantled and sophisticated weapons were recovered which are of no use to anyone, added police.

64.title: IKEA Hyderabad fined ₹6,000 for charging customer ₹20 for carry bag
64.article_body: IKEA Hyderabad was asked to compensate a customer ₹6,000 for charging him ₹20 for a carry bag featuring IKEA's logo. Law student Kevin Sukirthy filed a complaint against IKEA under The Consumer Protection Act alleging that charging for the bag with IKEA's brand name amounts to unfair trade practice. IKEA has been given 45 days to comply with the order.

65.title: Mali accuses France of sending weapons to militants
65.article_body: Mali has accused France of supplying arms and intelligence to Islamist militants. In a letter to the UN Security Council, Mali's Foreign Minister Abdoulaye Diop said France has violated its airspace on multiple occasions and delivered arms to Islamist fighters in an attempt to destabilise his country. This comes as France pulled the last of its troops out of Mali.

66.title: When Sachin retired from Tests, we thought Rohit is the answer: Karthik
66.article_body: Talking about Rohit Sharma's Test career so far, wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said Rohit was called the "big deal" after his consecutive hundreds in his first two Tests. "And the fact that Sachin [was] retiring from Tests...everybody thought this is it...but life and sport as it turns out is never exactly what you think it is," added Karthik.

67.title: Alvaro messaged on Instagram, I answered after a long time: Morata's wife
67.article_body: Ex-Real Madrid footballer Alvaro Morata's wife Alice Campello said Alvaro asked many people to introduce him to her having seen her picture, but they had no common friends. "So, he wrote to me (on Instagram). I answered...after a long time," added Campello. "His friends and family...had never seen him like this...He kept telling...he wanted to marry me," she stated.

68.title: Nitin Gadkari unveils double decker AC e-bus in Mumbai
68.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari unveiled electric double decker AC bus in Mumbai today. The bus is manufactured by a firm called Switch Mobility. "Giving dynamic boost to the sustainable transportation sector, such initiatives are cost-effective solutions and achieve PM Narendra Modi Ji's vision of 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat' by cutting down oil imports and promoting indigenous resource," Gadkari tweeted.

69.title: Only Leshi is always in cabinet, what does CM see in her?: JD(U) MLA; Nitish replies
69.article_body: Commenting on JD(U) MLA Bima Bharti's remark that only Leshi Singh is always chosen in Bihar cabinet, CM Nitish Kumar said he is shocked. "What does the CM see in her?" Bharti said. "We will talk to Bharti...try to convince her not to give such statements...If she doesn't understand...wants to go anywhere else, she can think about it," Nitish added.

70.title: 13-yr-old apprehended for raping 3-yr-old near Gurugram; survivor critical
70.article_body: A 13-year-old boy was apprehended for allegedly kidnapping and raping a three-year-old girl in Nuh near Gurugram, police said. The incident took place on Tuesday when the victim followed her mother out of their house. "He picked her up and took her to a nearby field...raped her," police further said. The survivor is critical and is undergoing treatment, officials added.

71.title: Piyush Goyal inaugurates public systems lab for research at IIT Delhi
71.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal inaugurated a public systems lab (PSL) at the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Delhi. The PSL will work closely with the UN World Food Programme (UNWFP) to identify projects around food systems and innovations. One of the proposed initiatives is to send experts to the Ministry of Food to help make food-based safety nets efficient.

72.title: Death toll from blast at mosque in Kabul rises to 21
72.article_body: The death toll from a blast at a mosque in Kabul during evening prayers on Wednesday has risen to 21, police said, adding another 33 people have been injured. No group has claimed responsibility for the blast so far. Taliban spokesman Zabihullah Mujahid condemned the explosion and vowed that the "perpetrators...will soon be brought to justice and will be punished".

73.title: My parents were very dramatic about my dating life: Janhvi Kapoor
73.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor revealed her parents were "very dramatic" about her dating life. "It's like 'when you like a guy, come to us and we'll get you married'," she added. Janhvi, who is the daughter of late actress Sridevi and producer Boney Kapoor, said, "They don't understand the concept of like chill." Janhvi recently featured in 'Good Luck Jerry'.

74.title: I demand Supreme Court's intervention: TRS MLC on Bilkis Bano case
74.article_body: TRS MLC K Kavitha criticised the Gujarat government after 11 convicts sentenced to life imprisonment for gangraping Bilkis Bano walked free in Gujarat. "To keep everyone’s trust in the law, it's necessary that this shameful decision should be withdrawn. I also demand the Supreme Court to intervene in this issue by taking suo moto cognisance into the case," she added.

75.title: Man molests woman at vegetable market in Santacruz; caught by Sena workers
75.article_body: A 25-year-old woman was allegedly molested by a man while buying vegetables at a market in Mumbai's Santacruz (West) on Monday. Some local Shiv Sena workers, who saw the man groping the woman, immediately caught him. The accused, Ankit Khalto (27), also reportedly flashed at the woman and passed obscene comments to her when she tried to resist.

76.title: Video showing Finland PM Sanna Marin partying leaked; criticised
76.article_body: The Prime Minister of Finland, Sanna Marin, has received criticism after a video of her partying was leaked online. "Finland is suffering from record high electricity prices, lack of health care & elderly care professionals and this is how our leader is spending her time!" a Twitter user wrote. "The most incompetent PM we ever had," another user tweeted.

77.title: Myanmar to import Russian fuel amid price rise: Myanmar military
77.article_body: Myanmar plans to import Russian fuel amid rising prices, a junta spokesperson said. Zaw Min Tun said authorities permitted to import petrol from Russia, favoured for its quality and low cost. In the past week, petrol stations have shut down in various parts of the country because of shortages. Myanmar is also considering joint oil exploration with Russia and China.

78.title: 19-yr-old security worker in Munich arrested over Nazi salute
78.article_body: Police in Munich arrested a 19-year-old for making a Hitler salute. Officers reportedly saw the individual making the Hitler salute towards a group of Israeli athletes on the sidelines of the European Athletics Championships. The straight-armed gesture, which was used by Nazis as a greeting, was outlawed soon after the end of the World War II in Germany and Austria.

79.title: Talks about ODI cricket dying are nonsense, I wish there was another format too: Rohit
79.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma said the talks about ODI cricket dying are nonsense. He added, "For me...cricket is important, be it any format. I'd never say that ODIs are getting finished or T20Is are getting finished or Tests are nearing an end." Rohit stated, "I wish there was another format as well because for me...playing the game is most important."

80.title: 137 out of 140 candidates fail BCCI umpires' exam
80.article_body: The BCCI recently conducted a level-2 exam for umpires for eligibility to officiate in women's and junior matches that are categorised as Group D. Out of the 140 candidates who appeared for the exam, 137 failed. The cut-off for the exam was 90 marks out of 200 (100 for written test, 35 for viva and video, and 30 for physical).

81.title: Prepare for 5G launch: Telecom Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw to telcos
81.article_body: Informing about the issuance of 5G spectrum allocation letters, Telecom Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Thursday took to Twitter and wrote, "5G update: Spectrum assignment letter issued. Requesting TSPs to prepare for 5G launch." Department of Telecommunications received a payment of around ₹17,876 crore from Reliance Jio, Bharti Airtel, Adani Data Networks and Vodafone Idea for spectrum allocation.

82.title: Outsiders living in Jammu and Kashmir can also vote in UT now: Official
82.article_body: J&K Chief Electoral Officer Hirdesh Kumar has said after the abrogation of Article 370, many people who were not enlisted as voters are now eligible to vote and anyone who is living ordinarily can also get enlisted as a voter in J&K. He said that J&K will get around 25 lakh new voters including outsiders after revision of electoral rolls.

83.title: 2 suspected terrorists with al-Qaeda links arrested in West Bengal
83.article_body: The Special Task Force (STF) of West Bengal Police arrested two suspected terrorists having links with al-Qaeda in North 24 Parganas district on Wednesday night. The two, identified as Raqib Sarkar and Kazi Ahshanullah, were wanted in several cases. According to STF sources, both are members of al-Qaeda in Indian Sub-continent (AQIS), with Sarkar being the operation-in-charge of West Bengal.

84.title: US and Taiwan to hold trade talks after China holds military drills
84.article_body: The US government plans to hold talks with Taiwan on a wide-ranging trade agreement. US Trade Representative's office said that 'formal negotiations' were meant to grow trade and regulatory cooperation which would involve close official interaction. The announcement comes after China held military drills close to Taiwan after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited the island nation.

85.title: Pandit scolds players a lot, will it work with int'l players?: Aakash
85.article_body: Discussing six-time Ranji Trophy-winning coach Chandrakant Pandit's appointment as KKR's new head coach, ex-India opener Aakash Chopra said, "Pandit scolds the players a lot...Will the same strategy work with the international players?" "In the IPL, you fondle more and scold less because you get a lot of established players," added Aakash. "The strictness works with small kids," he stated.

86.title: It was a long vacation for me: Deepak Chahar on India comeback after injury
86.article_body: Talking about his break from cricket since February this year due to injuries, India pacer Deepak Chahar, who's part of India's playing XI for the first ODI against Zimbabwe, said, "It was a long vacation for me. Now fully fit and back." Chahar had picked up a hamstring injury in the T20Is against West Indies at home earlier this year.

87.title: Govt spent ₹38 lakh on Trump's 36-hour visit to India in 2020, RTI reveals
87.article_body: The central government spent approximately ₹38 lakh during former US President Donald Trump’s 36-hour visit to India in 2020. Responding to an RTI, the External Affairs Ministry said these charges included accommodation, meals, logistics etc. Trump, his wife Melania, daughter Ivanka, son-in-law Jared Kushner and several top officials visited Ahmedabad, Agra, and Delhi on February 24-25, 2020.

88.title: Retired officer in Mumbai tries to return Amazon order, loses ₹1.04 lakh
88.article_body: A 67-year-old Mumbai-based retired sales tax officer was cheated of ₹1.04 lakh after he posted a return request on Amazon. As per the complainant, he received a call from a man claiming to be Amazon executive who sent him a link to fill in details like credit card number etc. On sending the details, money was deducted from his account.

89.title: Dr Reddy’s, Sun Pharma, others settle Zantac case, to pay $500,000
89.article_body: Several pharmaceutical companies, including Teva, Dr Reddy’s and Sun Pharmaceutical, have agreed to pay over $500,000 in all to US' Joseph Bayer. The plaintiff, Bayer, had alleged that he developed oesophagal cancer from taking the over-the-counter heartburn drug Zantac, which was originally marketed by GSK's forerunner and sold by several other companies. He has now agreed to drop his case.

90.title: Blackstone to sell 13.6% stake worth ₹4,000 cr in Sona BLW: Reports
90.article_body: American private equity firm Blackstone is likely to sell a 13.6% stake in Indian automotive component maker Sona BLW Precision Forgings (Sona Comstar) via a block deal on Thursday, according to reports. Blackstone, which currently holds a 34.12% stake in Sona BLW, is likely to raise ₹4,000 crore through the transaction. Shares of Sona BLW fell around 6% on Thursday.

91.title: Over 13 lakh Income Tax Returns filed after July 31: Data
91.article_body: The latest data on the Income Tax website showed that over 13 lakh Income Tax Returns (ITRs) were filed after July 31, which was the deadline to file ITRs by salaried individuals. Till July 31, over 5.83 crore ITRs were filed, while the number increased to 5.96 crore as on August 15. Taxpayers have to pay penalties for late filing.

92.title: 16-yr-old commits 6 robberies in less than 24 hrs in Delhi, apprehended
92.article_body: A 16-year-old boy allegedly committed six robberies in less than 24 hours in South Delhi's Hauz Khas, Saket and other areas on Independence Day, police said. The minor, allegedly a drug addict involved in over 13 cases of robberies, theft and snatching, was apprehended on Wednesday, police added. "All the complainants...saw the accused leave on a blue scooter," police stated.

93.title: Why does the media always tell lies?: Shehnaaz Gill on rumours of dating Raghav Juyal
93.article_body: Addressing the rumours that she is dating her 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali' co-star Raghav Juyal, Shehnaaz Gill said, "Media jhoot kyun bolti hai? Media har bar jhoot bolti hai (Why does the media always tell lies?)." She added, "Just because we're standing next to someone, or hanging out, doesn't mean we are dating...I will get hyper now."

94.title: Goa MLA writes to PM Modi, demands dismissal of Irani over 'illegal' bar
94.article_body: Goa Congress MLA Sankalp Amonkar wrote to PM Narendra Modi demanding immediate sacking of Union Minister Smriti Irani to pave way for a free and fair investigation into her alleged 'illegal' bar business in Goa. "All circumstantial evidence...documents of Registrar of companies Maharashtra and GST details prove prima facie that the restaurant in question...is run by her family," said Amonkar.

95.title: India's Russian oil buying falls in July, Saudi imports rise: Report
95.article_body: For the first time since March, India's crude oil imports from Russia fell in July, while supplies from Saudi Arabia rebounded, trade and industry sources said. India imported 8,77,400 barrels per day (bpd) of oil from Russia in July, which is nearly 7.3% lesser than in June. India imported 25.6% more oil from Saudi Arabia at 8,24,700 bpd in July.

96.title: They wanted me to remake '3 Idiots' in Tamil, didn't do that: Madhavan
96.article_body: R Madhavan, during an interview, was asked about his decision of directing remakes of his own films. To this, he replied, "They wanted me to remake '3 Idiots' in Tamil but I didn't do that. I realised that it would become difficult for me." The 2009 film also featured Aamir Khan, Boman Irani and Kareena Kapoor Khan.

97.title: Do people not trust CM Mamata?: BJP leader on 'New TMC' posters in Kolkata
97.article_body: Following posters claiming "new and reformed TMC will come into being in six months" were put up in Kolkata, BJP’s Samik Bhattacharya asked, "Does it mean...people no more trust [CM] Mamata Banerjee…TMC needs a new face?" The posters had photographs of TMC National General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee. Bhattacharya added, "People are against TMC’s loot. The party’s days are numbered."

98.title: Man who set self on fire after rape allegation by partner dies in Raj
98.article_body: A 50-year-old man, accused of raping his live-in partner, died on Tuesday around two weeks after he had set himself on fire outside a police station in Rajasthan, officials said. The man, a resident of Deva village, had attempted self-immolation on August 3, a day after an FIR was registered against him. He had sustained 70% burn injuries, police added.

99.title: Business as it should be: Mittal praises DoT on quick spectrum allocation letter
99.article_body: Bharti Airtel Chairman Sunil Mittal praised the Department of Telecom (DoT) after the company was provided with a letter of 5G spectrum allocation within hours of paying ₹8,312.4 cr in dues. He said, "No fuss, no follow-up, no running around the corridors...This is a first in my 30 years of first-hand experience with the DoT. Business as it should be."

100.title: 5 arrested in Hyderabad including a minor for selling hash oil
100.article_body: The Hyderabad Police arrested four men along with one minor for selling hash oil and seized 80 boxes of the oil (around 400 ml) and five cell phones from them. According to the police, the accused purchased hash oil for ₹40,000 and started selling it. They were nabbed by the police while they were disposing of the remaining oil.

101.title: Brad Pitt grabbed Angelina Jolie by the head aboard a private jet in 2016: Report
101.article_body: Angelina Jolie alleged that Brad Pitt assaulted her on a flight in 2016, according to a leaked FBI report obtained by Rolling Stone. Jolie told FBI officials that Pitt "grabbed her by her head" and "pushed her into the bathroom wall", according to the report. Pitt repeatedly punched the ceiling of the plane during the "outburst", the report said.

102.title: Katrina would only eat ice to stay dehydrated: Sidharth on 'Kala Chashma'
102.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra, who starred with actress Katrina Kaif in the song 'Kala Chashma', said Katrina would "only eat ice" during the song's shooting. Sidharth revealed this during an episode of 'Koffee with Karan 7' where he was accompanied by Katrina's husband Vicky Kaushal, with Vicky saying "What" in response. Sidharth added Katrina did this to stay "dehydrated" and "lean".

103.title: Venice fines 'idiot' tourists for surfing up Grand Canal
103.article_body: Two foreign tourists who sped down Venice's Grand Canal on motorised surfboards were fined €1,500 (₹1.2 lakh) each on Wednesday. Mayor Luigi Brugnaro tweeted a video of the surfers, calling them "two overbearing idiots making a mockery of the city". Mayor's office has also instructed lawyers to start proceedings against the pair for damaging the image of the city.

104.title: Was offered roles of watchman, car cleaner after Bombay Talkies: Vineet
104.article_body: Vineet Kumar Singh, who featured in season 3 of 'Rangbaaz: Darr Ki Rajneeti', has agreed that there is a stereotype in the film industry. He revealed he was offered roles of a watchman, car cleaner and pav bhaji vendor after he did 'Bombay Talkies'. "We will have to explain to the audience that we can do different roles," he stated.

105.title: I react to people wanting realistic acting from stars with smile on face: Pankaj
105.article_body: Actor Pankaj Kapur has said that he reacts to people demanding realistic acting from stars with a smile on his face. He added that it is a part of growth. "Somewhere better things are being realised...better sense will eventually prevail," Pankaj further stated. The veteran actor added that the moment when better sense prevails must be celebrated.

106.title: 9 students injured after slipping on moving escalator in Hyderabad
106.article_body: At least nine school students suffered injuries when they slipped and fell on a moving escalator at a multiplex in Hyderabad's Banjara Hills on Thursday. The children had reportedly come to watch the free screening of 'Gandhi' movie as part of the celebrations to mark 75 years of India's independence. They were shifted to a nearby hospital for treatment.

107.title: File FIR against BJP leader Shahnawaz Hussain in rape case: Delhi HC to police
107.article_body: Delhi High Court has directed Delhi Police to register an FIR against BJP leader Shahnawaz Hussain in a rape case and complete the investigation within three months. The court criticised police for its "complete reluctance" to register the FIR. A woman had alleged Hussain raped her in 2018 in a Delhi farmhouse after lacing her cold drink with a sedative.

108.title: Pune Traffic Police felicitated by US Embassy after US delegation's visit
108.article_body: US Embassy Chargé D’Affaires Patricia A Lacina felicitated Pune Traffic Police for the smooth passage of a US delegation's convoy on Tuesday and Wednesday. Lacina felicitated the traffic branch on Wednesday by presenting a commemorative coin from the US Embassy, Deputy Commissioner of Police (Traffic) Rahul Shrirame said. "She appreciated the work of traffic branch officials and others," he added.

109.title: Dharmendra shares pic with Ranveer Singh, says 'His reflection changed me'
109.article_body: Veteran actor Dharmendra took to Instagram and shared a picture with his 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' co-star Ranveer Singh. Along with the picture, Dharmendra wrote, "Friends, young, loving and energetic Ranveer's reflection changed me and my body language." The film, directed by Karan Johar, also features Alia Bhatt and Shabana Azmi.

110.title: If he gets five games in a row, he's going to perform: Uthappa on Gaikwad
110.article_body: Cricketer Robin Uthappa has said Ruturaj Gaikwad can play all three formats of the game in the future and the management needs to invest in him. "Ruturaj is not getting those number of games...if he gets five games in a row, he's going to perform," stated Uthappa. Gaikwad has scored 135 runs in nine T20Is he has played so far.

111.title: Central Railway introduces Aadhaar counter at Pune railway station
111.article_body: The Central Railway has started an Aadhaar counter at Pune railway station. The counter, which began functioning on August 15, provides facilities such as new Aadhaar enrolment and mandatory Aadhaar update, including biometric for children, for free. According to an official, similar counters will be introduced at stations like Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) and Nagpur gradually.

112.title: Saudi woman jailed for 34 years over her tweets
112.article_body: A Saudi court has sentenced a woman named Salma al-Shehab to 34 years in prison over her Twitter activity. A human rights organisation said that charges filed against her included "providing succour to those seeking to disrupt public order and undermine the safety of the general public and stability of the state, and publishing false and tendentious rumours on Twitter".

113.title: India announce their playing XI for 1st ODI against Zimbabwe
113.article_body: India captain KL Rahul won the toss and elected to bowl first in the first ODI against Zimbabwe in Harare. India's playing XI includes pacer Deepak Chahar. Rahul and Chahar are playing an international match for the first time since February. Sanju Samson will be keeping wickets for India in the match. Notably, India are touring Zimbabwe after six years.

114.title: Rohingyas are threat to national security: BJP spokesperson
114.article_body: BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia on Wednesday said that Rohingyas are a "threat" to national security. "Arvind Kejriwal is doing the politics of appeasement, keeping the national security at bay," Bhatia added. "There were news reports in which the facts were meant to mislead the public. The Ministry of Home Affairs has clarified on that," Bhatia stated.

115.title: Rajasthan Congress to give ₹20 lakh aid to deceased Dalit boy's family in Jalore
115.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Thursday tweeted that the state Congress Committee has announced a ₹20 lakh financial aid to the family of the nine-year-old Dalit boy, who died after he was beaten up at his school in Jalore. "This matter has been taken up under the Case Officer Scheme so that fast track trial can be conducted," Gehlot wrote.

116.title: Kerala HC allows medical termination of 28-week pregnancy of minor rape victim
116.article_body: The Kerala High Court allowed medical termination of the 28-week-old pregnancy of a 14-year-old rape victim based on the report of a medical board which had examined the victim. The anguish caused by the continuation of the pregnancy can be presumed to cause a grave injury to the mental health of the minor, the medical board said.

117.title: WHO urges caution after first human-to-dog monkeypox case
117.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) has urged people infected with monkeypox to avoid exposing animals to the virus after the first reported case of human-to-dog transmission. The case was recorded in Paris. Rosamund Lewis, the WHO's technical lead for monkeypox, said that "waste management is critical" to lower the risk of contaminating rodents and other animals outside the household.

118.title: Australian TV CEO calls Emilia Clarke 'short, dumpy girl', company apologises
118.article_body: Referring to Emilia Clarke's character in 'Game of Thrones', the CEO of an Australian TV company Foxtel, called her a "short, dumpy girl". Patrick Delany was speaking at the premiere of 'House of the Dragon'. Soon after, his company issued a statement and said, "The Foxtel Group apologies if his remarks were misunderstood and caused any offence."

119.title: 'Can I be sure figures shared are trustable?' Taapsee on profit-sharing
119.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu has said that she wishes to "reap the benefits" from a film's profits if she's headlining the project. However, she added, "But can I be sure that the figures shared are trustable? I'm not sure." Taapsee revealed she did two Telugu films with a backend deal and said, "Since they were my friends, I could expect transparency."

120.title: Nadal out of Cincinnati Open after losing 1st game since return from injury
120.article_body: World number three Rafael Nadal crashed out of the Cincinnati Open after losing in his first match in over a month since withdrawing from his Wimbledon semi-final against Nick Kyrgios. Nadal lost 6-7(9-11), 6-4, 3-6 to Borna Coric in the second-round match. "It's difficult to take a lot of positive things from this match. I need to practice," said Nadal.

121.title: Hang the teacher, don’t abuse Rajput community: Raj minister on Dalit boy's death
121.article_body: After a nine-year-old Dalit boy was allegedly beaten to death by his teacher in Rajasthan’s Jalore, state minister Rajendra Gudha said that the government, if needed, should "hang the teacher who killed the child but it's wrong to abuse the entire Rajput community". "The entire Rajput society is being projected as a villain. It's not good," Gudha added.

122.title: I'm sure actor & director in me will come in conflict someday: Madhavan
122.article_body: R Madhavan has said, "As an actor, when you go to a film set, you want to keep the director in you away." He added that he didn't have much experience in directing before 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect'. Madhavan stated he will not let the actor and director in him get into a conflict, however, added, "I'm sure...it'll happen someday."

123.title: Man arrested for raising Pak flag in Rajasthan's Jodhpur, probe launched
123.article_body: Police have arrested a man for allegedly raising Pakistan's national flag in Rajasthan's Jodhpur district. The accused, identified as Sanju Khan, also shared a pro-Pakistan post on social media, Times Now reported. Khan was arrested following complaints by villagers. Police have launched an investigation to find out Khan's intention and if he has any link with Pakistan, reports added.

124.title: 8 YouTube news channels banned by govt over 'fake anti-India content'
124.article_body: Ministry of Information & Broadcasting has blocked eight YouTube-based news channels. "The blocked channels were observed to be using fake and sensational thumbnails, images of news anchors and logos of certain TV news channels to mislead viewers to believe that the news was authentic," the ministry said. "Fake anti-India content was being monetised by the blocked channels," it added.

125.title: Sooraj used to embarrass her by flirting with women before his friends in Goa: Jiah's mother
125.article_body: Jiah Khan's mother Rabia Khan began her deposition in the trial against Sooraj Pancholi, who was booked for abetment of her suicide. Rabia said in Goa, Sooraj used to embarrass Jiah in front of his friends by flirting with other women before her. She added Jiah spoke about being at a very strange place and not wanting to stay there.

126.title: Farmers' unions begin 75-hour dharna in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri
126.article_body: Samyukta Kisan Morcha, an organisation of farmers' unions, launched a 75-hour 'dharna' in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri on Thursday at 11 am. Farmers are demanding the sacking of Union Minister of State for Home Ajay Mishra, whose son Ashish was arrested in Lakhimpur Kheri case. Farmers are also demanding the release of farmers who have been jailed in the case.

127.title: Judge bans abortions in North Carolina after 20 weeks of pregnancy
127.article_body: A federal judge has ruled that abortions in the US state of North Carolina are not legal after 20 weeks of pregnancy. Judge William Osteen reinstated an unenforced abortion ban with exceptions in cases of medical emergencies. "Neither this court...nor counsel, nor providers have the right to ignore the rule of law as determined by the Supreme Court," Osteen wrote.

128.title: Sooraj physically abused her, called 'dirty names', threw her out of car: Jiah's mother
128.article_body: Jiah Khan's mother, Rabia Khan, on Wednesday told a court in Mumbai that months before her alleged suicide in June 2013, her daughter had accused her then boyfriend Sooraj Pancholi of physically and verbally abusing her. Rabia added that Pancholi also called her "dirty names". She said Jiah told her that Pancholi had thrown her out of his car once.

129.title: 'Oo Antava': Alia Bhatt on the dance number she wants to be part of
129.article_body: Talking about an existing dance number that she would want to be part of, actress Alia Bhatt named 'Oo Antava' from the film 'Pushpa: The Rise'. Alia added that she wants to star in the dance number with actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu, who was a part of the song originally as well as the film's actor Allu Arjun.

130.title: Twitter wants access to Musk's text messages amid lawsuit: Report
130.article_body: Twitter is reportedly seeking access to Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s text messages amid its lawsuit over the $44 billion merger deal. Court documents showed that Twitter wants a search conducted on all of Musk's text messages during "the relevant period" for "material" related to its lawsuit. However, it was not clear as to what exactly the "relevant period" referred to.

131.title: Brazil police accuse Prez Bolsonaro of spreading COVID misinformation
131.article_body: Brazil's federal police accused President Jair Bolsonaro of discouraging use of mask during the pandemic and suggesting that those vaccinated against COVID-19 were at risk of contracting AIDS. A police official sent a document to Brazil's Supreme Court, saying Bolsonaro's effort to discourage compliance with health measures was a crime. The police sought authority from court to charge Bolsonaro.

132.title: B'wood is a weird place: Kashyap on Ranveer being dropped from 'Bombay...'
132.article_body: Reacting to actor Ranveer Singh recently revealing he was "unceremoniously dropped" from 'Bombay Velvet', the film's director Anurag Kashyap said, "Ranveer was dropped because the industry thought he wouldn't be able to drive the money in." "But today, they're...making films with him," added Kashyap. Kashyap stated that Bollywood is a "weird place". "My star value wasn't high," Ranveer had shared.

133.title: CDC Director announces changes in agency citing slow response to COVID
133.article_body: The Director of United States' Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Dr. Rochelle Walensky, has announced changes in the organisation. Walensky cited the agency's shortcomings in quickly responding to public health threats like COVID-19 and monkeypox. Some of the changes include increased use of preprint scientific reports, restructuring communications office and revamping CDC websites.

134.title: COVID-19 still there, precaution vaccine dose necessary: Dr VK Paul
134.article_body: NITI Aayog’s Dr VK Paul said that COVID-19 is still there and the precaution vaccine dose is necessary. "COVID-19…has risen in the past few days. All precautions are necessary, masks and social distancing are crucial," Paul added. "Corbevax vaccine has been approved for precaution dose for heterologous or mix-match option," Dr Paul stated.

135.title: Class 9 student shot in neck by man she rejected in Bihar's Patna
135.article_body: A Class 9 girl student was shot in the neck by the man she allegedly rejected in Bihar's Patna, police said. The incident took place in Sipara's Indrapuri area on Wednesday and was captured on CCTV. The man can be seen following the 15-year-old victim and fleeing from the spot after shooting her. She was returning from coaching, police added.

136.title: Make people aware of special cells created to help inter-caste couples: Delhi HC
136.article_body: The Delhi High Court laid stress on making people aware of the existence of special cells created in every district to receive complaints related to harassment of inter-caste couples. "It’s a noble cause…Please sensitise people. It’s the need of the hour. If it's an inter-caste marriage, that needs to be protected," Justice Jasmeet Singh said.

137.title: China's efforts to coerce, undermine Taiwan risk miscalculation: US
137.article_body: China's efforts to coerce and undermine Taiwan risk miscalculation, Daniel Kritenbrink, top US diplomat for East Asia, said. China has been carrying out military drills around the island this month in response to US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Taiwan visit. Kritenbrink added that China is using Pelosi's trip as an excuse to change the status quo, jeopardising peace.

138.title: Making distinction between 'freebies' and 'welfare schemes' important: SC
138.article_body: Supreme Court, while hearing a petition, said that making a distinction between "freebies" and "welfare schemes" is important. It added that it cannot prevent political parties from making promises to entice the voters for their electoral gains. The court further asked if promises of free education and some essential units of power can be considered "freebies".

139.title: Bengaluru civic body bans sale of meat, animal killing on Janmashtami
139.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike's (BBMP) animal husbandry department issued an order prohibiting animal slaughter and sale of meat on Krishna Janmashtami that is on Friday (August 19). The circular dated August 17 said that all slaughter houses within BBMP area limits will be banned from butchering animals and selling meat, with the same applying to retail stores as well.

140.title: Work on 32 km Pune ring road stretch to begin after this monsoon
140.article_body: The Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority (PMRDA) will begin work on the 32-kilometre stretch of the ring road between Chakan and Nagar Road after this monsoon. The 170-kilometre-long Pune ring road will be built in stages. It will connect six national highways running through the Pune Metropolitan Region (PMR), including Mumbai-Pune, Pune-Nashik and Pune-Bengaluru highways.

141.title: This is not flipping a light switch: US on India-Russia relations
141.article_body: The US has said that it is going to be a long-term proposition for India to reorient its foreign policy away from Russia. "We have seen countries around the world speak clearly...against Russia's aggression in Ukraine. But we also recognise...that this is not flipping a light switch," US further said, adding that India-Russia relations "extend back decades".

142.title: Didn't 'like' watching her with actors other than Dad: Ranbir on Neetu
142.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said he "didn't like" to watch his mother Neetu Kapoor feature with other actors, barring her husband and late actor Rishi Kapoor. "I never liked those films," added Ranbir. Ranbir stated that he and his sister Riddhima would watch films starring their parents "day and night". "Every film...that my parents have done [has been challenging]," he said.

143.title: Don't see Shubman opening in Zimbabwe series: Robin Uthappa
143.article_body: India batter Robin Uthappa has said Shubman Gill is unlikely to open India's innings in the Zimbabwe ODIs. "Shikhar will open the batting along with KL Rahul...The T20 WC [is] coming up...[and] KL is playing after about a 90-day break...it's important that he gets some time under his wings," explained Uthappa. The first ODI against Zimbabwe will be played today.

144.title: India sees 12,608 new COVID-19 cases, 39% higher than yesterday
144.article_body: India has reported 12,608 new COVID-19 cases and 72 deaths in the last 24 hours including 29 reconciled deaths in Kerala, according to the Health Ministry. Active cases in the country went down to 1,01,343, while the daily positivity rate increased to 3.48%. India reported 16,251 recoveries in the last 24 hours, taking the total recoveries to 4,36,70,315.

145.title: Wall Street down first time in the week after Fed minutes released
145.article_body: After the minutes from the US Federal Reserve's July meeting were released on Wednesday, stocks on Wall Street fell broadly for the first time since the start of the week. The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 0.5%, while the S&P 500 index slipped 0.7%. The stocks fell because the Federal Reserve didn't give a clear direction on the interest rates.

146.title: Apple planning to hold iPhone 14 launch event on September 7: Report
146.article_body: Apple is targeting to hold a launch event on September 7 to unveil the iPhone 14 line, as per a report. The company is rumoured to announce iPhone 14, iPhone 14 Pro, iPhone 14 Pro Max and updates on the Apple Watch. Apple is planning to stream the event online, rather than an in-person gathering.

147.title: Rahul would like to prove that he hasn't lost his rhythm: Manjrekar
147.article_body: Ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar has said KL Rahul's selection for the upcoming T20 World Cup seems like a "certainty" but the 30-year-old would like to prove to selectors that he hasn't lost his "rhythm" in the ODIs against Zimbabwe. On Rahul's batting position against Zimbabwe, Manjrekar said, "Rahul will be best suited to bat at the top of the order."

148.title: BMC to ban single-use plastic for food deliveries
148.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has now decided to go against restaurants and hotels that use single-use plastic for their daily business operations. In first phase, we took action against shops and markets and in the next phase, we will penalise hotels and restaurants for using plastics and urge them to use steel utensils, Deputy Municipal Commissioner Sanjog Kabre said.

149.title: Trains on CR's fast line delayed after accident between Nahur, Bhandup stations
149.article_body: Trains on Central Railway's (CR) fast line were delayed after an accident was reported on Thursday morning. The trains were reportedly delayed by 30 minutes. Few trains stopped on down fast line were cleared around 8.20 am, a CR PRO said. A woman was hit by a train while crossing track between Nahur and Bhandup stations, a CR official informed.

150.title: 'Colour of skin' may be why Tigray crisis not getting attention: WHO chief
150.article_body: WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus described the "man-made catastrophe" in Ethiopia's Tigray region as the "worst disaster on Earth". "I haven't heard, in the last few months, any head of state talking about...Tigray situation...Maybe the reason is the colour of the skin of the people in Tigray," Tedros said, adding, "The humanitarian crisis in Tigray is more than in Ukraine."

151.title: An uplifting, tender, beautiful film: Swara Bhasker on 'Laal...'
151.article_body: Speaking about 'Laal Singh Chaddha', actress Swara Bhasker took to Twitter and wrote, "'Laal Singh Chaddha' is such an uplifting, tender, beautiful film about the vastness of our small lives." She added, "Excellent adaptation by Atul Kulkarni sir." The film, featuring Aamir Khan and Kareena Kapoor Khan, is an official remake of Tom Hanks-starrer 'Forrest Gump'.

152.title: How can justice for any woman end like this?: Mahua on Bilkis Bano case
152.article_body: After 11 convicts sentenced to life imprisonment for gangraping Bilkis Bano walked free in Gujarat, TMC MP Mahua Moitra tweeted, "These rapists and murderers feted after being let out in...shortest possible time. And we're lectured on how to respect women?" "How can justice for any woman end like this? Amit Shah? Narendra Modi?" Moitra wrote while sharing Bilkis Bano's statement.

153.title: It's a 'very bold' move: Bhogle on KKR appointing Pandit as head coach
153.article_body: Reacting to Chandrakant Pandit, who has won six Ranji Trophies as coach, being appointed as the new head coach of Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR), cricket commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted that it is a "very bold" move. "His do-it-my-way style has worked...well with players...below international level where he's held their hand sometimes but pushed them hard at others," added Bhogle.

154.title: Jailed LeT terrorist fatally shot after he snatches J&K policeman's rifle
154.article_body: A jailed Pakistani Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) terrorist was fatally shot after he snatched the rifle of a policeman and fired at police personnel in Jammu and Kashmir, officials said. The incident took place when the terrorist was taken near the International Border for a weapons recovery operation. A policeman was also injured and was hospitalised, Jammu Zone ADGP Mukesh Singh added.

155.title: Adani Group gets provisional nod for wind projects in Sri Lanka
155.article_body: Adani Green Energy has been granted provisional approval by Sri Lanka for two wind projects for an investment of over $500 million, Sri Lankan Energy and Power Minister Kanchana Wijesekera said. The projects will come up in Mannar and Pooneryn. This is the first official confirmation of Adani Green Energy's investments in the island nation's energy sector.

156.title: Punjab farmers leave for 72-hr anti-govt protest over Lakhimpur Kheri case
156.article_body: Farmers from Punjab on Wednesday left for Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri to participate in a 72-hour-long anti-government protest on Samyukt Kisan Morcha's call. The protest is scheduled from August 18-20 to seek justice in the Lakhimpur Kheri case. Farmers are demanding the sacking of Union Minister of State for Home Ajay Mishra, whose son Ashish was arrested in the case.

157.title: Comparing wife to other women amounts to mental cruelty: Kerala High Court
157.article_body: A husband comparing his wife to other women and constantly taunting her for not being the spouse of his expectations amounts to mental cruelty, the Kerala High Court has held. The ruling by the court came while dismissing a man's appeal against a family court order dissolving his marriage after nearly 13 years of separation from his wife.

158.title: MHA’s statement gives 'correct position' on Rohingyas: Hardeep Puri
158.article_body: After Centre clarified that it hasn’t given directions to provide EWS flats to illegal Rohingya migrants in Delhi, Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri tweeted MHA’s statement, calling it the “correct position”. This comes after Centre asked Delhi government to ensure Rohingyas are kept at their present location for their deportation. Earlier, Puri tweeted that they will be shifted to flats.

159.title: Planting of explosives over in one of Noida's twin towers
159.article_body: The demolition company that is in the process of fixing explosives in 32-storey Supertech twin towers in Noida, completed the process in one of the towers - Ceyanne, on Wednesday. Fixing of explosives in the tower started on August 13 following Supreme Court's hearing. The 103-metre-tall towers - Apex and Ceyanne - are scheduled to be demolished on August 28.

160.title: Sensex falls 189 points to 60,071 points, Nifty opens at 17,890
160.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in the red on Thursday with Sensex and Nifty falling 189.02 points and 54.30 points, respectively. The Sensex opened at 60,071.11 points and Nifty at 17,890. Dr Reddy's Laboratories, Sun Pharma, HDFC and NTPC's stock slipped on the Sensex, while Power Grid, Bharti Airtel, Asian Paints and ITC were among the major Sensex gainers.

161.title: Focus on your acting instead of threatening public: MP Home Minister to Arjun Kapoor
161.article_body: Speaking on Arjun Kapoor's remarks on the movie boycotts, Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra said, "I don't think it's good that a flop actor threatens public." Mishra added, "It's better to focus on your acting rather than threatening the public. I want to ask him, do you or your 'tukde-tukde' supporters dare to make a film targeting other religions?"

162.title: World's 1st case of human-to-dog monkeypox transmission reported in Paris
162.article_body: A dog has been infected with monkeypox after catching the virus from its owners, the World Health Organisation (WHO) has said. The world's first case of human-to-dog transmission occurred in Paris and was reported in The Lancet. The two men noticed lesions on their greyhound dog 12 days after they started getting symptoms.

163.title: US CEO who cut his own $1 million pay to raise staff salaries to $70,000, resigns
163.article_body: Dan Price, CEO of Seattle-based Gravity Payments, has resigned amid claims that he assaulted a woman after a business dinner in January. In 2015, Price cut his own salary from $1 million to set the minimum pay of all his staff to $70,000. Sharing his email on Twitter, Price wrote that his presence had become a "distraction" for employees.

164.title: Will withdraw campaign in Bihar if govt provides 5-10 lakh jobs in 2 yrs: Kishor
164.article_body: Poll-strategist Prashant Kishor said if newly formed 'Mahagathbandhan' government in Bihar provides five to 10 lakh jobs in next one or two years, he would withdraw his 'Jan Suraj Abhiyan' and extend support to CM Nitish Kumar-led government. "State will witness more political upheavals in near future," Kishor added. Earlier, CM Kumar had announced an arrangement of 10 lakh jobs.

165.title: Salman Khan recommended my name for 'Maine Pyar Kiya': Mohnish Bahl
165.article_body: Speaking about actor Salman Khan, actor Mohnish Bahl said that their friendship is old and began before they entered the film industry. "Salman was trying to be a part of 'Maine Pyar Kiya'. He recommended my name. And then the rest is history," he added. 'Maine Pyar Kiya' also featured Bhagyashree and was directed by Sooraj Barjatya.

166.title: I 'don't know' if Dinesh Karthik will get a chance: Kaif on Asia Cup
166.article_body: Ex-Team India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said he "doesn't know" if wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik will get a chance in Asia Cup, considering stiff competition. Ex-Chairman of BCCI's selection committee Kris Srikkanth had said Karthik will probably be a reserve batter. Ex-Team India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel earlier stated only one among Karthik or Rishabh Pant can be part of the lineup.

167.title: Whole team is slightly nervous ahead of T20 World Cup: Rishabh Pant
167.article_body: Talking about the upcoming T20 World Cup in Australia, India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant said the team is "slightly nervous" but they are focussing on the "process" after being knocked out in the group stage in the last edition."Hopefully we'll reach the final and do the best for the team," he added. India's campaign will start against Pakistan on October 23.

168.title: Hyd Police arrest interstate drug peddler, seize drugs worth around ₹1 lakh
168.article_body: The Hyderabad City Police on Tuesday arrested an interstate drug peddler and seized drugs worth around ₹1 lakh. The accused, identified as Priteesh Narayan, is a resident of Goa who had been selling drugs for past eight years at Anjuna Beach, and in Telangana and Andhra Pradesh, police said. He was arrested while trying to sell drugs in Kakatiyanagar.

169.title: Gadkari removed from BJP's Parliamentary Board due to his rising stature: NCP
169.article_body: The NCP reacted to BJP dropping Union Minister Nitin Gadkari from its Parliamentary Board and said that the party removed him due to his rising stature as an "astute politician". "When your calibre and capabilities grow and you pose a challenge to the higher ups the BJP downsizes you. The tainted get upgraded," NCP Spokesperson Clyde Crasto said on Twitter.

170.title: Billionaire Jim Ratcliffe interested in buying Manchester United: Report
170.article_body: British billionaire Jim Ratcliffe is reportedly interested in buying Manchester United. After a report emerged claiming that the Glazer family may consider selling a stake in the club, a spokesperson for Ratcliffe said, "If the club is for sale, Jim is definitely a potential buyer." Earlier on Wednesday, the world's richest person Elon Musk had joked about buying Manchester United.

171.title: I was like 'Why is the script so bad?': Karan Johar on 'Student of the Year'
171.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar revealed he had second thoughts about making Sidharth Malhotra-starrer 'Student of the Year'. Karan said he asked his creative director, "Why are we making this film? Have you read the script?" He added, "I started shooting for the film...I was like, 'Why is the script so bad?'." Karan said the film was "very different" from the script.

172.title: Pune city likely to witness light rainfall till August 20: IMD
172.article_body: Pune city is likely to witness light rainfall till August 20, India Meteorological Department (IMD) officials said. "There is no warning issued for city or ghat regions for August 19 and August 20. However, rainfall activity in ghat regions is likely to pick up pace," IMD stated. A 'yellow' alert has been issued for ghat regions around Pune for Thursday.

173.title: Gambling racket busted in Bengaluru; 13 arrested, over ₹1 lakh seized
173.article_body: The City Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru Police on Wednesday arrested 13 persons in connection with an illegal gambling racket and seized cash worth over ₹1 lakh from them.
