Sichuan, a key manufacturing location for semiconductor industries, has ordered all factories to shut down for six days to ease the power shortage. Power cuts in Sichuan will reportedly hit factories belonging to some of the biggest electronic companies.

347.title: Central Railway to use bedsheets made by Pune's Yerawada jail inmates
347.article_body: Central Railway (CR) has decided to use bedsheets made by Pune's Yerawada Central Jail inmates. As a pilot project, 89 handmade bedsheets will be supplied to Mumbai CSMT-Nizamuddin Rajdhani Express and Pune-Ahmedabad Duronto Express. "It's being done on an experimental basis...after feedback from passengers...bedsheets will be made available on more such trains," an official said.

348.title: Was taking selfie, 100 people looked at me: Rahman on being only brown guy at H'wood party
348.article_body: Recalling attending a party thrown by Disney for their 2013 film 'Frozen', music composer AR Rahman said, "It was also the 90th birthday of Walt Disney so there was a statue of him." He added, "So...I was taking a selfie (with the statue), I look back and 100 people were looking at me. I was the only brown person there."

349.title: Railways considering semi-high speed track between B'luru, Hyderabad: Report
349.article_body: Indian Railways is considering building a semi-high speed track between Bengaluru and Hyderabad which may reduce travel time to less than 2.5 hours, according to reports. The track will reportedly be compatible for running trains at a speed of 200 km/hour. The track will be built between Bengaluru's Yelahanka Station and Hyderabad's Secunderabad Station, covering a distance of 503 km.

350.title: Country seeing difference between PM's words, deeds: Rahul on Bilkis Bano case
350.article_body: After 11 convicts sentenced to life imprisonment in Bilkis Bano gangrape case walked free in Gujarat, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi asked, "What message is being given to the women of the country by those who peddle lies about 'naari shakti'?" "Prime Minister Ji, the entire country is seeing the difference between your words and deeds," Gandhi added.

351.title: 14-yr-old abducts, rapes 3-year-old girl in a field in Haryana
351.article_body: A three-year-old girl was allegedly abducted and raped by a 14-year-old in a field in Haryana's Nuh district. The girl's mother was unaware that her daughter was following her to the field and didn't realise when the accused abducted her daughter. I heard my daughter crying when I was going to the field, the victim's father said.

352.title: 3 ex-Noida fire officers booked for issuing fire NOC to twin towers
352.article_body: Three former Chief Fire Officers (CFOs) of Noida have been booked over alleged irregularities in providing no objection certificate (NOC) to Supertech's illegal twin towers in Noida Sector 93A. The action has been taken based on the report of the inquiry committee constituted under the chairmanship of DIG Fire Services. FIR has been lodged at Phase 2 police station.

353.title: Vijay Deverakonda's mother holds pooja for him & Ananya at Hyd home
353.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda's mother organised a pooja for him and his 'Liger' co-star Ananya Panday at their home in Hyderabad ahead of their film's release on August 25. Sharing photos from the pooja on Twitter, he wrote, "This whole month touring across India and receiving so much love already felt like God's blessing! But mummy feels we needed His protection."

354.title: ICC releases men's Future Tours Program for 2023 to 2027
354.article_body: The ICC on Wednesday released the men's 2023-2027 Future Tours Program (FTP) cycle. The 12 full members of the ICC will play a total of 777 international matches, including 173 Tests, 281 ODIs and 323 T20Is, in the 2023-2027 FTP cycle compared to the 694 in the current one. India will be playing 38 Test matches in 2023-2027 FTP cycle.

355.title: Nitin Gadkari, Shivraj Singh Chouhan dropped from BJP's Parliamentary Board
355.article_body: The BJP on Wednesday dropped Union Minister Nitin Gadkari and Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan from its Parliamentary Board, the party's highest organisation body. BS Yediyurappa, Sarbananda Sonowal, Iqbal Singh Lalpura, Satyanarayan Jatiya, K Laxman and Sudha Yadav were included in the Board. The Board, headed by JP Nadda, also has PM Narendra Modi, Rajnath Singh and Amit Shah.

356.title: Kashmiri Hindus protest in J&K's Budgam over targeted killings
356.article_body: A group of Kashmiri Hindus on Wednesday staged a protest in J&K's Budgam district after Kashmiri Pandit Sunil Kumar was killed by terrorists on Tuesday. Demonstrators reportedly demanded justice for Sunil's family and asked to be relocated to safer places. "Terrorists...made it clear...they're going to kill all...Kashmiri Pandits," said Kashmiri Pandit Sangarash Samiti (KPSS) chief Sanjay Tickoo.

357.title: Philips CEO Frans van Houten to be replaced amid ventilators recall
357.article_body: Philips Chief Executive Officer (CEO) Frans van Houten will step down from the post, the Dutch health technology firm said on Tuesday. He will be replaced by Roy Jakobs, the head of the company's Connected Care businesses, on October 15. This comes after a recall of its ventilators cut Philips' market value by more than half over the past year.

358.title: Singer jumps 16% after Jhunjhunwala's firm buys 42.5 lakh shares
358.article_body:
Shares of Singer India jumped over 16% in early trade on Wednesday after late billionaire investor 
Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's RARE Investments bought 42,50,000 shares in the company. Singer's shares had hit the upper limit on Tuesday. RARE Investments bought the shares at ₹53.50 apiece after Retail Holdings India BV sold about 22% stake in the firm through bulk deals.

359.title: I don't know: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Law Minister Kartikeya Singh facing arrest
359.article_body: Commenting on Bihar Law Minister Kartikeya Singh's allegedly outstanding arrest warrant, CM Nitish Kumar said that he has no information about the same. "I do not know," Nitish told reporters. Singh and 17 others are accused in a 2014 kidnapping case. "Is Nitish trying to take Bihar back to Lalu's times?" BJP's Sushil Kumar Modi remarked.

360.title: Request PM to reverse Guj govt’s order: KTR as Bilkis rape convicts walk free
360.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao has requested PM Narendra Modi to intervene in a matter where 11 life imprisonment convicts in Bilkis Bano gangrape case were released from Godhra sub-jail under Gujarat government's remission policy. "I request PM to…reverse Gujarat government’s order...it's sending out a wrong message that a rapist walks out of jail and is welcomed," Rao added.

361.title: Zinc soars as Nyrstar's Budel smelter announces halt in production
361.article_body: After Nyrstar's Budel smelter announced it would halt production from September 1, zinc prices surged nearly 7.2% on the London Metal Exchange on Tuesday. Budel smelter, which is one of the largest in Europe, has been operating at a reduced rate since Q4 of the last fiscal because of soaring energy prices. Smelters require high amounts of electricity to operate.

362.title: Google showcases AI robots that fetch soda, chips
362.article_body: Google has showcased AI robots that help its employees fetch soda and chips from breakrooms with ease. The robots are not ready for sale. "It's going to take a while before we can really have a firm grasp on the direct commercial impact," Google said. The company has not yet embedded them with the "OK, Google" summoning feature.

363.title: I’m happy to be essaying realistic police officer: Drashti on 'Duranga'
363.article_body: Actress Drashti Dhami, speaking about her upcoming OTT series 'Duranga', said she is happy to play a realistic police officer. "I feel more people will be able to resonate with my character because she's a wife and mother at home and a cop at work," she added. 'Duranga' is an adaptation of the South Korean drama 'Flower of Evil'.

364.title: Holiday over, work begins: Kartik as he returns to 'Shehzada' sets
364.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan took to Instagram Stories and shared a selfie as he returned to the sets of his upcoming film 'Shehzada'. Along with the picture, he wrote, "Chutti khatam, kaam shuru (Holiday over, work begins)." The film, which is directed by Rohit Dhawan, will also feature actress Kriti Sanon. The actor recently featured in Anees Bazmee's 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'.

365.title: There hasn't been a more important series than this Asia Cup for Kohli: Sodhi
365.article_body: Former India cricketer Reetinder Sodhi has said that there hasn't been a more important tournament than the upcoming Asia Cup for Virat Kohli in recent years. "Fingers crossed, we all are praying that we see Virat Kohli in excellent form in the Asia Cup," added Sodhi. Virat has been on break since India's tour of England.

366.title: After Ghulam Nabi Azad, 3 more leaders quit J&K Congress posts
366.article_body: After Ghulam Nabi Azad, three more senior Congress leaders quit the party's newly formed committees in Jammu and Kashmir within hours of being nominated. The other leaders include two-time MLA from Sopore, Haji Abdul Rashid, Mohammad Amin Bhat and Gulzar Ahmed Wani. Azad was made Jammu and Kashmir campaign committee chairman and was also named on the political affairs committee.

367.title: SRK said he would've done my role if he was younger: Vijay on Darlings
367.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma, who played the role of an abusive husband in 'Darlings', with Alia Bhatt portraying his wife, said actor Shah Rukh Khan stated he would have done the role "if he was younger". Vijay had earlier shared that SRK "thanked" him for doing the film. However, Vijay admitted that he thought his career will "end" following this portrayal.

368.title: Bengaluru-based Exponent Energy raises $13 mn in Series A round
368.article_body: Bengaluru-based electric vehicle charging infrastructure company, Exponent Energy, has secured $13 million in a Series A funding round. The round was led by Lightspeed Venture Partners and saw participation of existing investors like YourNest Venture Capital, 3one4 Capital and AdvantEdge Founders. The company had raised $6 million in seed and Pre-Series A funding round in December 2021.

369.title: Red panda, leopard skins recovered from North Bengal, 3 arrested
369.article_body: Two red panda skins and one leopard skin were seized from three wildlife traffickers in North Bengal’s New Jalpaiguri on Tuesday, officials said. The three arrested accused are citizens of Nepal. "All three are habitual offenders. They...entered India with skins from Nepal and were going to...Bhutan where consignment was to be delivered for ₹30 lakh," a senior forest official said.

370.title: UK inflation surges to 10.1% in July, its highest in 40 years
370.article_body: British consumer price inflation surged to 10.1% in July, which is the highest it has been since February 1982, data from the Office for National Statistics showed on Wednesday. The figures showed that prices rose by 0.6% in July from June on a non-seasonally adjusted basis. The annual retail price inflation rate reached 12.3%, the highest since March 1981.

371.title: BEST's 1st e-double-decker bus likely to be in public service from Sept: Report
371.article_body: Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport's (BEST) first electric double-decker bus in Mumbai is expected to be commissioned for the public in September 2022, as per a report. The first double-decker electric bus will likely be unveiled on 18 August 2022, the report said quoting sources. The prototype electric double-decker bus is ready with all necessary permissions, the reports added.

372.title: Arvind Kejriwal launches 'Make India No. 1' mission
372.article_body: Delhi CM and Aam Aadmi Party National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal has launched the 'Make India No. 1' mission. "We have to make India great again," Kejriwal said. "It has been 75 years of Independence. India gained a lot but there's...a question among people that several small nations that attained independence after us, surpassed us...Why did India lag behind?" Kejriwal added.

373.title: Nandan Nilekani interrupts interviewer to ask meaning of 'OG', video surfaces
373.article_body: A video has surfaced online wherein Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani could be seen interrupting an interviewer to ask the meaning of OG. While the interviewer referred to Infosys as the "OG for entrepreneurship in India", Nilekani interrupted and asked, "What is OG?", to which she clarified, "The original gangster." Commenting on the video, a user wrote, "What a sweet moment."

374.title: MP gets 1st Vistadome coach in Bhopal-Jabalpur Jan Shatabdi Exp
374.article_body: With the introduction of a Vistadome coach in Bhopal-Jabalpur Jan Shatabdi Express, Madhya Pradesh got its first Vistadome coach, railway officials said. Principal Secretary of the tourism and culture department, Sheo Shekhar Shukla, said that with this coach, tourists can enjoy the views of the hills, rivers and nature between the two cities. The coach is equipped with large windows.

375.title: 5 foreigners charged as mercenaries in Donetsk, 3 face death penalty
375.article_body: A Russia-backed court in Donetsk region has charged five foreign nationals with being mercenaries, out of whom, three face death penalty, according to Russian state media. The five foreign nationals from Britain, Croatia and Sweden were captured in and around Mariupol while fighting with Ukrainian forces. In June, Donetsk authorities sentenced two Britons and one Moroccan citizen to death.

376.title: Aadhaar number mandatory to get govt benefits and subsidies: UIDAI
376.article_body: The Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) has said that if a citizen doesn't have an Aadhaar number, he/she may not be entitled to avail government subsidies and benefits. The UIDAI said that a citizen may avail the benefits, subsidies and services through alternate and viable means of identification along with Aadhaar enrolment identification number till Aadhaar number is assigned.

377.title: China's Sichuan limits power supply to homes, offices amid heatwave
377.article_body: Authorities in China's Sichuan province began limiting electricity supply to homes, offices and malls on Wednesday due to a power crunch triggered by heatwave and drought, state media reports said. Government offices have been asked to not set air conditioners lower than 26 Celsius (78.8°F). Commercial and recreational activities like fountain and light shows during night hours will be suspended.

378.title: My Test career was 'almost over' before it started: Lee on McGrath's prank
378.article_body: Discussing a prank played on him by ex-Australian player Glenn McGrath during his Test debut, ex-Australia pacer Brett Lee said, "Adam Gilchrist was...telling me to...enjoy and while I was listening...McGrath...[tied] my shoelaces together." "When I hopped up, I fell over. My Test career was almost over before it started," added Lee. "McGrath...would always...[play] a practical joke," he stated.

379.title: ‘Vinash shakti’ won in Guj: Chidambaram on Bilkis rape convicts released from jail
379.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram said "vinash shakti" has won in Gujarat, after 11 life imprisonment convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case walked free in Gujarat. "Are you not shocked by pictures of 11 released men being welcomed with sweets?" Chidambaram tweeted. "Did the PM not know about the proposed action of the Gujarat government?" he asked.

380.title: N Korea fires 2 cruise missiles amid US-S Korea joint drill
380.article_body: North Korea fired two cruise missiles from the town of Onchon on Wednesday, a South Korean military source said. On Tuesday, US and South Korea kicked off a four-day preliminary joint drill in preparation for upcoming Ulchi Freedom Shield exercise. South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol said he's willing to provide phased economic aid to North Korea if it begins denuclearisation.

381.title: 5 of family, including 2 kids, killed as truck hits car near Pune
381.article_body: Five members of a family, including two kids aged four and seven, died and one person was severely injured when a container truck rammed into their car near Pune on Wednesday morning, police said. The incident occurred on Pune-Ahmednagar highway. Pune Police Superintendent Abhinav Deshmukh said the truck driver fled after the accident and search was on to arrest him.

382.title: Finland, Sweden's NATO bids will progress very quickly: Germany's Scholz
382.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz has said Finland and Sweden's NATO bids will "progress very quickly", and members including Turkey will ratify them soon. "In Finland and Sweden, we are gaining two valued allies," Scholz said. The two Nordic countries that remained neutral during the Cold War, applied to join NATO after the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

383.title: 4,000 litres of adulterated milk seized in Gujarat's Rajkot: Police
383.article_body: Four thousand litres of adulterated milk was seized from a truck at a checkpoint in Gujarat's Rajkot, police said. "A truck was stopped during checking of vehicles and adulterated milk that was made from chemicals like sulfates, phosphates and carbonate oils was seized," Rajkot DCP Praveen Kumar Meena said. "Adulterated milk was being supplied for last four months," he added.

384.title: Lebanese man who held up bank to access his own savings released
384.article_body: A Lebanese judge ordered the release of a man who last week took staff at a Beirut bank hostage for accessing his frozen savings. Bassam al-Sheikh Hussein surrendered after being permitted to withdraw $35,000, which he termed necessary for paying hospital bills. A crowd had gathered during the hostage situation with many chanting, "Down with the rule of the banks!"

385.title: E Palaniswami's appointment as AIADMK General Secretary not valid: Madras HC
385.article_body: E Palaniswami's appointment as All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) General Secretary is not valid, Madras High Court said. Palaniswami has been the AIADMK General Secretary since July 11, 2022. AIADMK's O Panneerselvam had filed a plea against the party's July 11 General Council meeting. Notably, Palaniswami is also the Leader of the Opposition in the Tamil Nadu Assembly.

386.title: 'Award-winning' director turns bike taxi driver in B'luru; chat with customer goes viral
386.article_body: A Twitter user's thread about his conversation with a bike taxi driver in Bengaluru has gone viral. The user said that the driver, who lost his job during the coronavirus pandemic, is also an award-winning director. "Created a Mini-series by investing all savings. Series got a great response and won around 15 Film Fests," the user said about the driver.

387.title: Chinese woman sues colleague for breaking ribs while hugging, gets ₹1 lakh compensation
387.article_body: A Chinese woman sued her colleague after he allegedly broke three of her ribs while hugging her. She said that the male colleague gave her an extremely tight hug leaving her in discomfort. She received medical attention after the pain stayed for about five days. Subsequently, a judge ordered the co-worker to pay her 10,000 yuan (₹1.16 lakh) as compensation.

388.title: They need to respect my terms too: Russell on Simmons' 'can't beg' remark
388.article_body: Responding to WI head coach Phil Simmons' remark that he can't beg people to play for their country, all-rounder Andre Russell, who hasn't played for WI since November 2021, said he still wants to win at least one more WC for the Windies. "But...we're not agreeing on certain terms...they have to respect my terms as well," he added.

389.title: More resignations likely if attention not paid: Handa as Azad quits J&K Cong post
389.article_body: Following Congress’ Ghulam Nabi Azad’s resignation from the post of chairman of the J&K campaign committee, party leader Ashwani Handa said that the right message is not reaching the high command. "If they don't pay attention to this committee, more resignations are likely. Everyone is feeling neglected," Handa added. Azad resigned from the post hours after the appointment.

390.title: BJP-JJP coalition govt believes in event management: Ex-Haryana CM
390.article_body: Former Haryana CM and Leader of Opposition Bhupinder Singh Hooda said the BJP-JJP coalition government believes in "event management". He claimed Haryana was a "knowledge hub" when Congress was in power, however, now state universities are falling out of the top 100. "This is because...a non-performing government, which only believes in event management, is running the state," he added.

391.title: Ravi Shastri had 'very low' tolerance for failure: Dinesh Karthik
391.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said ex-Team India head coach Ravi Shastri had "very low" tolerance for failure. "He had a very low tolerance for somebody who would bat at a certain pace he did not like or someone who was doing very differently in the nets and in the match, he would go and bat differently," added Karthik.

392.title: He should've just pulled his hair: NBA star Hart on Nunez's headbutt
392.article_body: NBA player Josh Hart has tweeted that Liverpool's Darwin Nunez would have escaped without punishment, if he had "pulled" Crystal Palace defender Joachim Andersen's hair, rather than headbutting him. Hart was referring to Tottenham Hotspur's Cristian Romero getting away without a booking for pulling Chelsea defender Marc Cucurella's hair during a match. Nunez was sent off following his headbutt.

393.title: Bengaluru to face scheduled power cuts from August 17-19
393.article_body: Several areas in Bengaluru will face power cuts from August 17-19 between 10 am and 6 pm due to repair and maintenance work undertaken by the Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM). The areas that will be affected today include Alagatta, Kenchamma Naguhalli, Hosur, etc. Whereas, areas that will be affected on August 18 include Hanumanthapura, Marenahalli, Rangapura, etc.

394.title: Vijay Deverakonda arrives at 'Liger' event in auto-rickshaw, video surfaces
394.article_body: A video of actor Vijay Deverakonda arriving at the sets of a dance reality show in Mumbai for promoting his upcoming film 'Liger' in an auto-rickshaw has surfaced on social media. In the video, Vijay can be seen wearing a white outfit. Reacting to the video, a fan commented, "Real hero with no attitude...very humble."

395.title: Chocolates worth ₹17 lakh stolen from Cadbury godown in UP: Report
395.article_body: About 150 cartons of Cadbury chocolate bars worth ₹17 lakh were reportedly stolen from a godown in Chinhat area of Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow. The incident occurred on the intervening night of Monday and Tuesday, the reports added. The godown was earlier the home of Cadbury distributor Rajendra Singh Sidhu, who recently shifted to an apartment in Gomti Nagar.

396.title: Jacqueline named as accused in ED chargesheet in ₹200 crore extortion case: Report
396.article_body: Jacqueline Fernandez has been named as an accused in the Enforcement Directorate's supplementary chargesheet filed in the ₹200 crore extortion case against conman Sukesh Chandrashekar, reports said on Wednesday. Reports said that she was aware of the extortion taking place. The ED had earlier attached ₹7.27 crore funds of Fernandez under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA).

397.title: Over 150 children dead in Zimbabwe measles outbreak
397.article_body: A measles outbreak in Zimbabwe has killed at least 157 children, with the death toll nearly doubling in less than a week, the government said. The total number of suspected measles cases nationwide has risen from 1,036 to 2,056 in just four days, Information Minister Monica Mutsvangwa said. Earlier, the government had blamed gatherings of religious sects for the outbreak.

398.title: 21-yr-old student from Puducherry dies of suspected drug overdose in Goa
398.article_body: A 21-year-old college student from Puducherry died of a suspected drug overdose at Goa Medical College and Hospital, a police spokesperson said. He was admitted to the hospital in serious condition on Tuesday, the spokesperson added. The youth had arrived in Goa along with his three friends on Saturday. However, his friends claimed he had not consumed any narcotics substances.

399.title: Anupam shares pics from David Dhawan's b'day party, says 'We're the best'
399.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher took to Instagram and shared pictures from filmmaker David Dhawan's birthday party. He posted pictures with David, Satish Kaushik, Shakti Kapoor, Chunky Panday and Rajpal Yadav. Along with the pictures, he wrote, "With birthday boy David Dhawan and my dearest friends who I have spent some memorable times with!! We are the best."

400.title: Apple suppliers to produce Apple Watch, MacBook in Vietnam: Report
400.article_body: Apple's suppliers are mulling over producing Apple Watch and MacBook in Vietnam for the first time, Nikkei Asia reported. According to reports, Apple suppliers Foxconn and Luxshare Precision Industry have started test production of Apple Watch and MacBook in Northern Vietnam. Apple has been shifting some areas of iPhone production from China to other markets, including India.

401.title: Woman dragged on road in snatching incident in Delhi; act caught on CCTV
401.article_body: A 46-year-old woman was dragged on the road when two bike-borne men pulled her bag in Delhi's Greater Kailash market. The incident, which took place on July 30, was caught on CCTV in which the woman can be seen falling down and being dragged. The victim was heading towards her guest house after having dinner when the incident happened.
